name: gorgon-group

procedures: T1055.002::[Gorgon Group] malware can download a remote access tool, [ShiftyBug], and inject into another process.
T1055.012::[Gorgon Group] malware can use process hollowing to inject one of its trojans into another process.
T1059.001::[Gorgon Group] malware can use PowerShell commands to download and execute a payload and open a decoy document on the victimâ€™s machine.
T1059.003::[Gorgon Group] malware can use cmd.exe to download and execute payloads and to execute commands on the system.
T1059.005::[Gorgon Group] has used macros in [Spearphishing Attachment]s as well as executed VBScripts on victim machines.
T1105::[Gorgon Group] malware can download additional files from C2 servers.
T1106::[Gorgon Group] malware can leverage the Windows API call, CreateProcessA(), for execution.
T1112::[Gorgon Group] malware can deactivate security mechanisms in Microsoft Office by editing several keys and values under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\.
T1140::[Gorgon Group] malware can decode contents from a payload that was Base64 encoded and write the contents to a file.
T1204.002::[Gorgon Group] attempted to get users to launch malicious Microsoft Office attachments delivered via spearphishing emails.
T1547.001::[Gorgon Group] malware can create a .lnk file and add a Registry Run key to establish persistence.
T1547.009::[Gorgon Group] malware can create a .lnk file and add a Registry Run key to establish persistence.
T1562.001::[Gorgon Group] malware can attempt to disable security features in Microsoft Office and Windows Defender using the taskkill command.
T1564.003::[Gorgon Group] has used -W Hidden to conceal [PowerShell] windows by setting the WindowStyle parameter to hidden.
T1566.001::[Gorgon Group] sent emails to victims with malicious Microsoft Office documents attached.
T1588.002::[Gorgon Group] has obtained and used tools such as [QuasarRAT] and [Remcos].

description: [Gorgon Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0078) is a threat group consisting of members who are suspected to be Pakistan-based or have other connections to Pakistan. The group has performed a mix of criminal and targeted attacks, including campaigns against government organizations in the United Kingdom, Spain, Russia, and the United States. (Citation: Unit 42 Gorgon Group Aug 2018)
